thread.title: Why Romelu Lukaku is officially European football's late goal king right now
thread.title_full: Why Romelu Lukaku is officially European football's late goal king right now

author: Jon Moody
title: Why Romelu Lukaku is officially European football's late goal king right now
text:
Sport Why Romelu Lukaku is officially European football's late goal king right now He's a player in demand for many reasons - but this handy trait is probably adding a few million to his value Share Romelu Lukaku after scoring yet another late goal (Photo: Getty) Share Get   
We may still be a few months away from the shutters on the football transfer window opening up, but we're already well aware of what will clearly be one of the big summer stories. 
The future of Everton striker Romelu Lukaku has been making headlines for weeks already. 
He's already told the Toffees that he won't sign a new deal - something he's been told to do by an England legend in order to ensure he wins trophies. 
Everton are understandably reluctant to sell, but if they're forced to, they'll be increasingly happy with his recent goalscoring heroics. It's harder than you realise for a man of that bulk to get off the ground (Photo: Getty) 
In recent weeks, the powerful Belgian has made a real habit of nabbing goals late on in games. 
Often, they've been vital - such as snatching a World Cup qualifying point for Belgium or securing a crucial victory for the Toffees. "Those words up there are spot on" (Photo: Dean Mouhtaropoulos) 
And on current form, there's little doubt he is European football's late goal king: his last eight goals have all come inside the last ten minutes of normal time and beyond, a run stretching back to Everton's 6-3 victory over Bournemouth on 4 February. 
From that game onwards, he's hit the back of the net in the 83rd, 84th, 80th, 81st, 82nd, 91st, 94th and 89th minutes. 
He's like the Belgian Sergio Ramos! Surely a million or two is being added to his value with each goal? If he keeps it up, we can picture the scenes in the Toffees boardroom when he eventually departs... poll loading What will Everton do with Romelu Lukaku and Ross Barkley this summer? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
